member.name: T:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.FormatOptions
member.summary:
A record of options to control structural formatting. For F# Interactive properties matching those of this value can be accessed via the 'fsi' value. Floating Point format given in the same format accepted by System.Double.ToString, e.g. f6 or g15. If ShowProperties is set the printing process will evaluate properties of the values being displayed. This may cause additional computation. The ShowIEnumerable is set the printing process will force the evalution of IEnumerable objects to a small, finite depth, as determined by the printing parameters. This may lead to additional computation being performed during printing. From F# Interactive the default settings can be adjusted using, for example, 
   open Microsoft.FSharp.Compiler.Interactive.Settings;;
   setPrintWidth 120;;

member.name: P:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.IEnvironment.MaxRows
member.summary: The maximum number of rows for which to generate layout for table-like structures. -1 if no maximum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.IEnvironment.MaxColumns
member.summary: The maximum number of elements for which to generate layout for list-like structures, or columns in table-like structures. -1 if no maximum.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.IEnvironment.GetLayout(System.Object)
member.summary: Return to the layout-generation environment to layout any otherwise uninterpreted object

member.name: T:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.Layout
member.summary: Data representing structured layouts of terms. The representation of this data type is only for the consumption of formatting engines.

member.name: T:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.Joint
member.summary: Data representing joints in structured layouts of terms. The representation of this data type is only for the consumption of formatting engines.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.DisplayModule.layout_to_string(Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.FormatOptions,Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.Layout)
member.summary: Convert any value to a layout using the given formatting options. The layout can then be processed using formatting display engines such as those in the LayoutOps module. any_to_string and output_any are built using any_to_layout with default format options.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.DisplayModule.output_any``1(System.IO.TextWriter,``0)
member.summary: Ouput any value to a channel using the same set of formatting rules as any_to_string

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.DisplayModule.any_to_string``1(``0)
member.summary:
Convert any value to a string using a standard formatter Data is typically formatted in a structured format, e.g. lists are formatted using the "[1;2]" notation. The details of the format are not specified and may change from version to version and according to the flags given to the F# compiler. The format is intended to be human-readable, not machine readable. If alternative generic formats are required you should develop your own formatter, using the code in the implementation of this file as a starting point.
Data from other .NET languages is formatted using a virtual call to Object.ToString() on the boxed version of the input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.LayoutOpsModule.unfoldL``2(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.Layout},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``1,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Tuple{``0,``1}}},``1,System.Int32)
member.summary: For limitting layout of list-like sequences (lists,arrays,etc). unfold a list of items using (project and z) making layout list via itemL. If reach maxLength (before exhausting) then truncate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.LayoutOpsModule.leftL(System.String)
member.summary: An string which is left parenthesis (no space on the right).

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.LayoutOpsModule.rightL(System.String)
member.summary: An string which is right parenthesis (no space on the left).

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.LayoutOpsModule.sepL(System.String)
member.summary: An string which requires no spaces either side.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.LayoutOpsModule.objL(System.Object)
member.summary: An uninterpreted leaf, to be interpreted into a string by the layout engine. This allows leaf layouts for numbers, strings and other atoms to be customized according to culture.

member.name: T:Microsoft.FSharp.Text.StructuredFormat.LayoutOpsModule
member.summary: A layout is a sequence of strings which have been joined together. The strings are classified as words, separators and left and right parenthesis. This classification determines where spaces are inserted. A joint is either unbreakable, breakable or broken. If a joint is broken the RHS layout occurs on the next line with optional indentation. A layout can be squashed to for given width which forces breaks as required.
